speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Janet Ashikaga  * * *  ## Peri Gilpin Introduces... {nick hartley}     _On Paramount Comedy Channel's "Frasier Weekend" Peri Gilpin (who plays Roz Doyle) introduced this episode of Frasier. She was sat on the set of "Caf e Nervosa" as she said the following:_

speaker: Peri
text: Roz and Schnoz is one of my favorites because I'm about nine months pregnant, I'm just about to have this baby, I find out that I'm going to meet the parents of the father of my child. I'm nervous, I don't want to meet them, I realize I have to and they show up and they've both got these GIANT noses.  _A clip of Roz and Schnoz is shown. Paula and Steve are in Frasier's apartment talking to Frasier:_
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Steve
text: We hope this isn't too awkward for her.  She sounded a little anxious on the phone.

speaker: Paula
text: Then again, who could blame her?  She doesn't know what kind of people we are.  A situation like this is enough to make anyone a little nervous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually you know, Roz really isn't the nervous type.  _Roz then opens the powder room door and nearly falls over when she sees the two large noses. The clip then finishes as Peri resumes._

speaker: Peri
text: The couple that plays the couple are a couple in real life. And they played it so beautifully and so well that we could not get through a take. The audience was laughing, we were laughing, in fact you can see in the episode that people are just laughing in the background.  _Another clip of the episode now has Niles, Daphne, Frasier, Roz and the Garretts in Frasier's apartment. Niles and Daphne are trying to control their laughter without success._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, why don't you show the Garretts the view?

speaker: Paula
text: Oh yes that would be nice, I could use a breath of fresh air.

speaker: Peri
text: We couldn't get a straight take, it's wonderful that way.   **Other "Frasier Week" Episodes (shown Oct. 5-9, 1998)** John Mahoney:      [[1.21]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_21/travels_with_martin.html "Travels With Martin") Travels With Martin David Hyde Pierce: [[1.21]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_21/travels_with_martin.html "Travels With Martin") Author, Author Jane Leeves:       [[2.17]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_17/daphnes_room.html "Daphne's Room") Daphne's Room (a.k.a. A Room With a View) Kelsey Grammer:    [[4.08]](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_8/our_father_whose_art_aint_heaven.html "Our Father Whose Art Ain't Heaven") Our Father Whose Art Ain't Heaven Peri Gilpin:       [5.21] Roz and the Schnoz   * * *  ## Transcript {nick hartley}     _Act One.  Scene One - Caf e Nervosa. It's the afternoon when Niles is sipping his coffee reading the newspaper.  Frasier enters and takes the seat next to him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier, listen to this: [_reads from paper_] "Michael Hawkins of Allentown, Pennsylvania, has agreed to donate his right lung to his younger brother Clovis.  Says Hawkins, �I got two lungs, but I only got one brother.'"  Isn't that something?

speaker: Frasier
text: It certainly is.

speaker: Niles
text: The love one brother feels for the other.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not surprised_] Hmm, what do you want?

speaker: Niles
text: I need you to come to a dog show with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: I would rather give you a lung! [_to passing waitress_] Latte, please.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I beg you.  It's at the Seattle Kennel Club tomorrow night and I can't go alone, Maris will be there.

speaker: Frasier
text: And in what class will Maris be showing?

speaker: Niles
text: She'll be showing no class! [_they laugh_] As she has ever since she hooked up with that reptile, Dr. Schenkman.  This will be my first time seeing them since we filed for divorce.
nextSpeaker: Frasier You know, here's an idea, Niles

speaker: Frasier You know, here's an idea, Niles
text: Don't go!

speaker: Niles
text: I've never missed the kennel club show. If I don't go this year, people will think I've let Maris and Schenkman intimidate me!  I want to prove that I'm strong and independent, and I can't do that alone.
prevSpeaker: Frasier You know, here's an idea, Niles

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right Niles, if it's moral support you need, I'll go with you.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll pick you up around eight.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks at watch_] And, I have a patient. [_packs things up_] Thank you, thank you, I knew I could count on you for this, Frasier.  It's nice to know that some things never change.

speaker: Roz
text: Do you guys know where I can get a cheap hotel room in a hurry?

speaker: Niles
text: Case in point! Goodbye, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, why do you need a hotel room?

speaker: Roz
text: I was supposed to move into my new place today, but they're still painting it.  I can't be around those fumes, and they've already rented my old apartment. [_to waitress who is bringing Frasier's coffee_] Grande decaf Latte, please. [_to Frasier_] I am literally on the streets.

speaker: Frasier
text: You just ordered a four-dollar cup of coffee.  "On the street" may be a tad dramatic.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I've got to start calling around, see if I can find something.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Roz, if you're stuck, my dad's going to San Francisco for the weekend.  You can always stay with me.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow!  That would sure make things easier. [_quick_] Okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_surprised_] Well then, that's settled.  That's that, then.

speaker: Roz
text: [_realizes_] Oh, you were just being polite, you didn't really mean for me to take you up on it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering_] No, no, no, no.  I wouldn't have suggested it if it wasn't something I wanted to do.  You should know that.

speaker: Roz
text: All right.

speaker: Waitress
text: [_brings coffee and bill_] Here you go.  There's your check.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll get that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, let me get that.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay. [_hands it to him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well then, lucky me - I'm getting everything I want today. _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier enters his apartment to find a rather worked-up Martin. Throughout this all of Martin's lines sound as if he is stressed._

speaker: Martin
text: Well it's about time!

speaker: Frasier
text: Calm down, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: I was starting to get worried.

speaker: Frasier
text: We've got plenty of time.

speaker: Martin
text: My plane leaves at five � clock.

speaker: Frasier
text: I just stopped off for your blood pressure medicine.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't need it!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stressed too_] Well, pack it anyway!  _Martin calms down and takes the bag that Frasier has brought in. He takes something out and it's a jewellery ring case._

speaker: Martin
text: What's this? [_opens it_] Earrings?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just a little something I picked up for Daphne at the drug store.  She ran some errands for me last week.

speaker: Martin
text: Nice.  What are they, sapphires?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Yes dad, I always buy precious stones at the same counter I pick up corn pads and Wart Be-Gone!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters from her room_] Shouldn't you two be going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, actually Daphne, we're just on our way but first there's a little something I wanted to give you - just a little token of my appreciation.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_excited, takes box_] Oh, Dr. Crane, you remembered!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of... course I did.

speaker: Daphne
text: Can you believe it was five years ago today that I came to work here?  I just knew you wouldn't let an important occasion like this go by unnoticed, but I wasn't expecting a gift.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a small gift, a tiny gift...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_opens the box and is shocked_] Oh my God, sapphires!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] Well, actually Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, these must have cost a fortune!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I-

speaker: Daphne
text: [_blabbering_] You know my friend Molly got a diamond bracelet from her boss but she worked for him for ten years _and_ she was sleeping with him!  And now I've got sapphires!  And I didn't even have to sleep with you!  Although now that I've got the sapphires - Oh God, what am I saying?  I'm giddy!  Is it rude if I go and try these on?  I don't care!  I have to see what these look like!  I've never had real jewelry, before, never! I'm speechless!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, she believes they're genuine sapphires.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic_] Gee, ya think?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm going to have to tell her the truth.

speaker: Martin
text: Why?  Didn't you see how happy she was, just let her enjoy them.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't let her think I gave her something I didn't.  Honesty between friends is far more precious than any gem.  I'm sure Daphne feels exactly the same way.

speaker: Daphne
text: I feel like a princess!  I'm never going to take them off! Oh thank you, [_hugs him_] thank you, thank you. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you know, I'm glad you like them...

speaker: Daphne
text: And you even remembered that sapphires are my birthstone. Is there no end to your thoughtfulness?

speaker: Frasier
text: Somebody has to keep track of these things.

speaker: Martin
text: [_stressed again_] You know, I really should be getting to the airport!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right dad, I'll get my keys!

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, absolutely not, I'll drive Mr. Crane.  From now on you're not lifting a finger around here. [_to Martin_] You ring for the elevator, I'll just grab my coat.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, but don't dawdle.  My flight's at five, they told me to get there an hour early.  _Martin gets his luggage and moves over to the corridor outside Frasier's apartment.  He is waiting for the elevator when Frasier comes out to see him off._

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you remember to pack your medicine?

speaker: Martin
text: [_stressed_] Yes, but I told you, I don't need it!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Roz. [_notices bags_] Frasier, help her with that. [_he does_]

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks, and thanks for letting me use your room.

speaker: Martin
text: No problem.

speaker: Roz
text: So, you're off to San Francisco.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah.  Duke and I took our shore leave there in '52. We're going back to retrace out steps.

speaker: Roz
text: That sounds like fun.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah.  We had a great time that weekend.  Back then there was no place like Frisco for a single guy cruising the streets looking for a good time.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with a different meaning_] You know dad, I think you'll find that Frisco hasn't changed all that much.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I hope not! [_laughs and enters elevator_]

speaker: Roz
text: Bye.

speaker: Martin
text: Bye. _Daphne enters the corridor from the apartment.  As she talks to Roz she tilts her head and extravagantly brushes her hair back from one ear, making the earrings obvious, or rather making her look mad._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Roz.  Just off to the airport, back in a bit, see you later.  _Daphne enters the elevator as Roz enters the apartment. Frasier puts her bags down as she closes the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on in, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, you're here a little earlier than I expected.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I had to get out of the apartment sooner than I thought. I left you a message.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, frankly I didn't check my machine all day today.

speaker: Roz
text: Listen Frasier, thank you so much for this.  I won't be an imposition, I promise.  You won't even know I'm here.

speaker: Machine
text: You have 13 messages. [_Frasier looks at Roz_]

speaker: Roz
text: I had my calls forwarded, I hope you don't mind.

speaker: Marco
text: [_v.o_] Roz, it's Marco.  I'm coming to town this weekend. Are you busy Saturday night, late?  Call me.

speaker: Roz
text: Obviously, Marco and I haven't talked for a long time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Something tells me you never talked for a long time.

speaker: Paula
text: [_v.o_] Roz, this is Paula Garrett, Rick's mom. [_Roz looks up, alarmed_] We just found out about the baby and well, we think it's important that we meet you.  Uh, we're leaving to see Rick in Paris the day after tomorrow, so anytime before that will be fine.  I'm running out now, maybe I'll try you later. [_beep_]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my god!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now Roz, just calm down.

speaker: Roz
text: What do they want?

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe they just want to meet you.  They are the grandparents of your child.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, I worked all this out with Rick!  He's twenty years old, he's still in college and it's best for everyone if I raise this baby by myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know that, but...

speaker: Roz
text: Now I'm supposed to put up with in-laws and I don't even have a husband?!  That's like posing nude for your art teacher and still flunking the course. [_Frasier is shocked_] Shut up! I needed the credits!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, listen, all they want is a short meeting.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, well, that's what they say now.  What if they want another one after that?  What if they won't leave me alone, what if - what if they don't think I'm a fit mother?

speaker: Frasier
text: What if they turn out to be nice supportive people that you're glad to have in your life?

speaker: Roz
text: I just don't want to do this, Frasier!  It's not comfortable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz... You know what, I could go with you, if you like? Oh, better yet, we can have them here tomorrow night.  Niles and I have a dog show around eight o'clock.  They can come before that.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll bet that's Mrs. Garrett.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm _not_ here.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Hello.  Yes, she is.  Yes, she did get your message. [_Roz signals to him to change_] No, no, I'm afraid she won't be able to meet you.  Yes I understand that you're upset.  I'm terribly sorry, goodbye. [_hangs up phone_]

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you, Frasier.  Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: That was Marco, now we're calling Mrs. Garrett.  _He picks the phone up and starts dialing.  FADE TO:_  **WHERE'S A GRINDSTONE WHEN YOU NEED ONE?**

speaker: Roz
text: All right, give it to me straight.  How do I look? _Roz enters wearing attire that looks like it's flashed from the 19th Century -- a long black dress with a white collar and cuffs, and a conservative string of pearls.  Of course, her pregnant bump makes it all a little more weird._

speaker: Frasier
text: Like Pollyanna grew up and got herself into a little trouble.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, why am I doing this?  How did I let you talk me into this?

speaker: Frasier
text: I will mean a lot to them.  Besides, it's a chance to learn about your baby's lineage.  A lot of things are inherited, you know.  Like intelligence, artistic ability...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh God, it's them.  I've got to check my makeup.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, there's no need to panic.  You know, this should be fun! It's like a little preview of who your child might be. _Roz enters the powder room as Frasier answers the door to Mr. & Mrs. Garrett.  Steve greets Frasier whilst his wife has her back turned talking to a neighbor.  Steve is a tall, handsome man in his late 30's, with an enormous, bulbous nose._

speaker: Steve
text: Hi there, Steve Garrett.

speaker: Steve
text: My wife's just... uh, honey?

speaker: Paula
text: Well, it was nice seeing you too!

speaker: Paula
text: Oh, what a coincidence, your neighbor goes to my hair salon. Hi, I'm Paula. [_shaking hands_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_recovering_] Frasier Crane.  Won't you please come in? [_they do_] Roz'll be out in a second.  She just went to powder her... self.

speaker: Steve
text: We hope this isn't too awkward for her.  She sounded a little anxious on the phone.

speaker: Paula
text: Then again, who could blame her?  She doesn't know what kind of people we are.  A situation like this is enough to make anyone a little nervous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually you know, Roz really isn't the nervous type. _Roz then opens the powder room door, smiling - and nearly falls over when she sees the two large noses._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, this is Steve and Paula Garrett.

speaker: Roz
text: [_astounded_] Hi.

speaker: Steve
text: Hi... oh, that's alright Roz, we don't blame you for being shocked.

speaker: Paula
text: I mean, we're used to it.  You should see the looks we get.

speaker: Steve
text: You were a little taken aback yourself, weren't you, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh-ho-ho, certainly not!

speaker: Paula
text: Oh, come on, it's alright!  Everyone comments on it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I must admit when I opened the door I...

speaker: Paula
text: [_finishes_] ...couldn't believe we were old enough to have a twenty year-old son.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_lying_] Exactly!  You know, you both look so young.  Don't they, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: [_still astounded_] Yes... young.  Very, very, young.

speaker: Paula
text: Oh Roz, I can see you're feeling a little uncomfortable, so let's just say, right up front, that we have no intention of intruding on your life.

speaker: Steve
text: Rick told us what a wonderful person you are.  We just wanted to meet you and offer any help or support that you think is appropriate.

speaker: Roz
text: [_happier and settling down_] Thanks.  That's very nice.  _Daphne then enters from the kitchen with a tray of food.  Paula and Steve have their backs turned to her._

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought your guests might be a little peckish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne Moon, Steve and Paula Garrett.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, I...

speaker: Frasier
text: I know!  It's amazing, isn't it?  They are actually the parents of a twenty year-old.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_glad for the excuse_] Amazing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, excuse me. [_opens door to Niles_] Oh, Niles.  You're an hour early.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry - hey, Roz. [_to Frasier_] Yeah, I thought you might like to grab a bite to eat before the dog show. [_notices them_] Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't realize that you had...

speaker: Niles
text: Had...

speaker: Frasier
text: Company, yes!  Steve, Paula Garrett, this is my brother, Niles Crane.  The Garretts are the grandparents-to-be of Roz's baby.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  Well, nice to meet you. [_to Daphne_] Hey, Daphne.

speaker: Paula
text: Did I hear you mention you're going to a dog show?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, the Seattle Kennel Club is having its annual event tonight.

speaker: Paula
text: You know, Steve and I went to that a few years ago.  We just love dogs!  We have two giant Schnauzers. _Niles quivers in place, fighting hysterics.  Daphne presses her fingers over her mouth.  Niles sits on the couch with a goofy smile.  Roz looks rather nervous and Frasier looks angry._

speaker: Steve
text: My goodness, Paula look at the view!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, why don't you show the Garretts the view?

speaker: Paula
text: Oh yes, that would be nice.  I could use a breath of fresh air! _Roz takes the couple out on the balcony and Daphne and Niles release their giggles._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_snaps_] Just stop it, the two of you!  My God, you're acting like a couple of two year-olds! _As they try to regain control of themselves, Martin comes in the front door._

speaker: Martin
text: I'm home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?  What are you doing here?

speaker: Martin
text: Aw, Frisco was a bust!  All our watering holes are gone, the steak house was a sushi bar, and this morning Duke and I went out for a walk.  We passed City Hall, and there's this big crowd, kinda like a pep rally or something.  So, we joined them.  Well, some official guy up front says something that we didn't hear and the next thing you know, everybody's throwing rice and all the men are kissing each other and all the women are kissing each other, and I'm not sure but I think Duke and I may be married. _Roz, Paula and Steve enter from the balcony.  Martin has his back turned to them._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, the whole weekend was like that!  Just one surprising event- [_turns round_] AAH!  _As he steadies himself against the bookshelf, Niles and Daphne have to hold their giggles in again.  Roz looks even more nervous._

speaker: Steve
text: I-I'm sorry, did we startle you?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, no, [_making up_] I-I didn't know we had company.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, this is Steve and Paula Garrett.  They're Rick's parents, you remember Rick?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh sure, yeah! [_shaking hands_] Hi, how are ya?  Nice to meet you, Marty Crane.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, they're just on their way to Paris to visit Rick.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah?  That sounds like fun.

speaker: Paula
text: Yeah, I'm just a little nervous.  I hear the Parisians can be kinda snooty.

speaker: Daphne
text: Excuse me, I've got something in the oven. [_turns to the kitchen_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_getting up_] Let me help you.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, uh, me too! _As they leave, Frasier and Roz shrug apologetically at Steve and Paula.  As soon as they make it into the kitchen, Martin, Niles and Daphne collapse with stifled, hysterical laughter.  Martin steadies himself against the refrigerator, Niles falls over, Daphne takes a quiche from the oven and puts it on the side._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_whispering_] We've got to stop, they'll hear us!

speaker: Steve
text: [_o.s., re: quiche_] Mmmm, what's that I smell?

speaker: Martin
text: [_whispering_] Probably Japan!  _Which sets them off anew.  Whilst they are killing themselves with laughter, Frasier walks in and watches over the scene in anger._

speaker: Frasier
text: _What_ is the matter with you people?!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on Fras!  Don't tell us you don't think this is funny!

speaker: Frasier
text: Not in the slightest!  These are two perfectly nice people, who happen to have large noses!  The three of you standing in here, sniggering like school childen!  Well, all right, fine.  If you can't get yourselves under control you can just stay in here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Quiche Lorraine, anyone?

speaker: Steve
text: Quiche her?  I hardly know her!

speaker: Paula
text: Oh, Steve!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_polite laugh_]

speaker: Steve
text: [_puts nose over it_] Boy, that smells wonderful.

speaker: Paula
text: [_with nose over it_] Does it ever.

speaker: Paula
text: Do you mind if I ask?  Is this homemade or store-bought?

speaker: Steve
text: Honey, don't ask that!  Pardon my wife, sometimes she gets a little nosey. _Niles, Daphne and Martin enter the room to hear the following. They are laughing underneath their hands and Frasier tries his utmost not to._

speaker: Paula
text: Me nosey?  You're the nosey one in the family.

speaker: Steve
text: Anyone who knows you knows you're nosey!

speaker: Paula
text: Anyone who knows you knows you're nosier! _Frasier walks back to the kitchen and hands the quiche off to Daphne. He is obviously ridden with laughter but stopping himself from revealing it._

speaker: Martin
text: Something wrong, Fras? _As soon as he makes it into the kitchen, he bursts with hysterical - and clearly audible - laughter.  Steve and Paula look confused, until he sticks his head back out._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing_] "Quiche her?  I hardly know her!" [_everyone laughs_] I just got that!  _End Of Act One. (Time: 13:47)  Act Two._  **LET'S TAKE A LITTLE BREATHER**  _Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Later, Roz is pouring herself a glass of water in the kitchen as Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Roz, in spite of a rather shaky beginning, I think this evening's turned out rather well.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh yeah, and you were absolutely right, Frasier.  Now I can see some of the qualities my baby can have.  A great sense of humor... a sweet disposition... a nose like an [_angry_] ANT- EATER!

speaker: Frasier
text: Frankly Roz, I think you're making a big deal out of nothing. As I remember, Rick had a perfectly fine nose, and so do you. I'm sure your baby's going to have one too.

speaker: Roz
text: Maybe you're right.  If Rick can beat those genes, my baby has a chance. _They enter the living room to find Niles and Daphne talking to Paula and Steve._

speaker: Paula
text: So, how long have you been working for Dr. Crane?

speaker: Daphne
text: Five years just yesterday.  In fact, he gave me a beautiful pair of sapphire earrings to mark the occasion.

speaker: Niles
text: [_unbelieving_] Frasier gave you sapphires?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] Who's for coffee?

speaker: Steve
text: I'll take some.

speaker: Paula
text: You know, you really must show those earrings to my husband. He's a jeweler, you know.  He could probably even tell you what mine the stones came from.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nervous_] Well, you know, maybe coffee's a bad idea if you've got that early flight in the morning.  Daphne, could you just take this back into the kitchen for me?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_feels ear_] Oh dear, one of my earrings has gone!  It must have fallen off somewhere!

speaker: Paula
text: We'll help you find it.

speaker: Steve
text: [_on his knees_] What does the earring look like?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, that's not really necessary.  Once you've seen one sapphire, you've seen them all.

speaker: Steve
text: Well, that's not exactly true, they vary widely in quality.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulls him to his feet_] You know, why don't you just get up? You have to get going, you know, we have plenty of people in order to form a search party. [_laughs_] And you know, we'll just trample each other.  Well, good night.

speaker: Paula
text: Alright, we are going to have a big day tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-huh, and you might as well get a little sleep before you take off.

speaker: Steve
text: You know, if you can't find that earring, I might be able to replace it.  Can I see the other one?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, [_begins to take it off_].

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quickly picks up something_] I've got it!  Here it is.  Bon voyage!

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, Daphne, just a second. [_to the couple_] Well, listen, it was wonderful of you to come.

speaker: Steve
text: Thank you for having us.  Roz, it was great meeting you.

speaker: Paula
text: Our door is always open.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  You guys have a great trip.

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodnight. [_shuts door on them_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Goodnight.

speaker: Steve
text: Goodnight.

speaker: Daphne
text: Can I have it then?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opens his hand_] Oh, I'm sorry, it's just a piece of lint. Well, the search continues.

speaker: Daphne
text: I feel just terrible!  The one precious thing that anyone has ever bought me in my whole stinking life, and I lose it.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I found it. [_hands it to her_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, I could kiss you!

speaker: Niles
text: Okay. [_she hugs and kisses him_]

speaker: Daphne
text: What's this?

speaker: Niles
text: [_nervous_] Nothing.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks at ring_] The setting's come loose.  It's only blue on top, the bottom's all coppery.  Dr. Crane...

speaker: Frasier
text: I know what you're thinking Daphne, and you're right. Obviously I...

speaker: Daphne
text: You've been swindled!  Where did you buy these?  I want to take these back and tell that lying cheat exactly what I think of him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, you just did.

speaker: Daphne
text: You knew? [_silence_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_embarrassed by scene_] Uh, Niles, how about a cup of coffee?

speaker: Niles
text: [_not about to miss this_] Thanks, Roz, cream and sugar.  _Roz, who didn't expect this answer, just sits on a chair as Niles stands next to Daphne staring at Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm terribly sorry, Daphne, I meant to tell you eventually.

speaker: Niles
text: You didn't need to.  Her earlobe's already turning green.

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut up, Niles!  You see Daphne, the truth is, I didn't remember your anniversary and well, I saw them and I thought they were pretty, so I bought them for you.  You thought they were genuine, you seemed so happy...

speaker: Daphne
text: They are pretty.  I suppose I can have them repaired.  I'll just take them back to the jewelry store.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stares at her_] Actually, I bought them at Raymond's.

speaker: Daphne
text: Raymond's drug store?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the good news is that they'll carry something for that ear infection-

speaker: Frasier
text: SHUT UP! _The doorbell sounds.  Frasier answers it to find Mr. and Mrs. Garrett with some photos._

speaker: Paula
text: It's us again!  Gee, I almost forgot.  Roz, I brought you something.  I thought you might get a kick out of these. Here are some pictures of Ricky when he was a boy. [_hands them over_]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thank you, that is so nice of you. [_looks_] Well, where is he?  I don't see him.

speaker: Steve
text: [_points_] There, in the middle.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh... he looks so different.

speaker: Steve
text: Oh, right, that was before his hockey accident.  The nose job changed his whole face.

speaker: Paula
text: I mean, not that the doctor didn't do a good job, but that's the Ricky you'll see in the baby.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, thanks.  Thanks a lot.

speaker: Paula
text: Oh, you're welcome.  And bye again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Take care.

speaker: Steve
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good to see you. _Paula and Steve exit through the front door.  As soon as Frasier closes it, Roz slams the photos against her chest._

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my _GOD!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Roz!  It can't be that bad, let me have a look!

speaker: Roz
text: No, no way, no!  I'll never hear the end of it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Please. _Roz releases the photos.  He looks... and mutely shows them to Niles and Daphne.  They stare._

speaker: Niles
text: Where _is_ the end of it?  _Roz whimpers.  Frasier comforts her.  The scene FADES OUT.  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. At the end of the day, Roz is sitting up in her nightgown staring at some pictures as Daphne enters, also in her nightgown. She sits at the dining table with her._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Roz, you're not still looking at that picture, are you?

speaker: Roz
text: Nope, this is a different one.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks_] Oh dear, look at the way the ears on this poor little girl stick out.

speaker: Roz
text: It's me.  Aged nine, the year before I got them fixed.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs_] Sorry, Roz, I didn't recognize you with those glasses.  Why is one side blacked out?

speaker: Roz
text: I had a lazy eye.

speaker: Roz
text: I got that fixed the next year.  Let's just say for birthdays I wasn't asking for ponies.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs_] You poor thing.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm just sitting here thinking, what if my kid gets Rick's nose, and my ears and eyes?  Throw in my grandfather's third nipple, I might as well pitch a tent and charge admission.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh come on, nothing like that's going to happen.

speaker: Roz
text: I just hate the idea of my kid being teased. [_sighs_] I know what that's like.  As long as my baby's in here [_rubs her womb_] I can protect it from anything.  But pretty soon this kid's going to be out there on his own.

speaker: Daphne
text: Every child goes through a bit of teasing.  I mean, it's a part of growing up.  At least yours will be lucky enough to have a mother who understands what it feels like.  And you'll know just what to say to make it all better.

speaker: Roz
text: I really hadn't thought of it that way.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm pretty good at finding the positive in things. I mean, look at what happened to me tonight; I could say, here I've worked for someone for five years and he forgot my anniversary and bought me a worthless piece of blue glass. But I'd rather say he gave me a nice pair of earrings just because he thought I'd like them.  Which is really rather sweet when you think about it.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah well, Frasier will be pleased to hear that!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm not going to tell him! [_they laugh_] Well, I'm ready for bed.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, me too. [_they stand_] Thanks again, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yep, you're welcome.

speaker: Roz
text: Ooh!  I just felt a big kick.

speaker: Daphne
text: You sure it wasn't a sneeze?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, ha-ha!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] That's the last one, I promise!  _Roz and Daphne laugh as they exit the room to Daphne's room.  End Of Act Two. (Time: 20:10)_
